description: This course focuses on key mechanisms used in attempts to transfer, institutionalize and
consolidate political power in Latin America, specifically: revolution and armed revolt, the
creation of authoritarian and military regimes, transitions to democracy and creation of new
economic structures. Using theory, historical fictional and factual accounts, students look
for the human ramifications of these dramatic changes as well as exploring their nature and
origins. Prerequisites: Political Science 112 and a course on Latin America. Offered
